availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Morris S. Wickersham (Philadelphia County, Pennsylvania, physician and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Philadelphia County, Pennsylvania, physician and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Married Mary Catherine O'Neill Wickersham in Philadelphia County, Pennsylvania, on June 4, 1844. Father of Mary Wickersham, Ida Wickersham, and Robert Wickersham. Broker in Philadelphia County in 1850. Physician in Philadelphia in 1860. Employed Pierre Derose, Carry Jones, and Emmeline Barry as servants in Philadelphia in 1860. Kentucky commissioner of deeds in Philadelphia from December 2, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, Philadelphia Middle Ward, p. 40B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, Philadelphia Ward 8, p. 1-2.
Historic Pennsylvania Church and Town Records, Burials, Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, reel 226.
New Jersey, U.S., Wills and Probate Records, 1739-1991, New Jersey. Surrogate's Court, Gloucester County, 1804-1922, p. 577-78.
Third Presbyterian Church, Philadelphia, Register of Marriages March 1837 to July 1866, U.S., Presbyterian Church Records, 1701-1907, Presbyterian Historical Society, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, p. 21.
KYR-0001-031-0093.
